comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Olsztyn [ˈɔlʂtɨn] (German: Allenstein; Old Polish: Holstin; Old Prussian: Alnāsteini; Lithuanian: Olštynas) is a city in northeastern Poland, on the Łyna River. Olsztyn has been the capital of the Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship since 1999. It was previously in the Olsztyn Voivodeship (and in other units in 1945–75 and 1975–98). The city has county status. Shortly after the outbreak of World War I, troops of the Russian Empire captured Allenstein in 1914, but it was recovered by the Imperial German Army in the Battle of Tannenberg.
